      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

      close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

              Discard

  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. download asan-linux-release-1030370.zip and unzip<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-1030370.zip and unzip<!----></span><br>2. run `./chrome --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport   --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist`<span class="line"><!---->2. run `./chrome --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport   --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist`<!----></span><br>3. search anything with<span class="line"><!---->3. search anything with<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> and then navigate to any other search engine (such as<span class="line"><!----> and then navigate to any other search engine (such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bing.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bing.com"><!---->bing.com<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>4. click `Open Search in Side Panel` to open side search in side panel<span class="line"><!---->4. click `Open Search in Side Panel` to open side search in side panel<!----></span><br>5. select any text in side search and right click to choose 'Search Google for XXX'<span class="line"><!---->5. select any text in side search and right click to choose 'Search Google for XXX'<!----></span><br><br>PS: In step 3 you must use <span class="line"><!---->PS: In step 3 you must use <!----></span>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>`. <span class="line"><!---->`. <!----></span>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>.xx`  cannot trigger the Side Search<span class="line"><!---->.xx`  cannot trigger the Side Search<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br># Root Cause <span class="line"><!----># Root Cause <!----></span><br><br>In `WebContentsImpl::OpenURL`[1], when `delelage_->OpenURLFromTab(this, params)` is called(1), the `source_render_frame_host`(2) could be freed in some conditions, the following use of `source_render_frame_host`(3) will cause UAF. <span class="line"><!---->In `WebContentsImpl::OpenURL`[1], when `delelage_-&gt;OpenURLFromTab(this, params)` is called(1), the `source_render_frame_host`(2) could be freed in some conditions, the following use of `source_render_frame_host`(3) will cause UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>WebContents* WebContentsImpl::OpenURL(const OpenURLParams& params) {<span class="line"><!---->WebContents* WebContentsImpl::OpenURL(const OpenURLParams&amp; params) {<!----></span><br>  TRACE_EVENT1("content", "WebContentsImpl::OpenURL", "url", params.url);<span class="line"><!---->  TRACE_EVENT1("content", "WebContentsImpl::OpenURL", "url", params.url);<!----></span><br>#if DCHECK_IS_ON()<span class="line"><!---->#if DCHECK_IS_ON()<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(params.Valid());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(params.Valid());<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br><br>  if (!delegate_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!delegate_) {<!----></span><br>    // Embedder can delay setting a delegate on new WebContents with<span class="line"><!---->    // Embedder can delay setting a delegate on new WebContents with<!----></span><br>    // WebContentsDelegate::ShouldResumeRequestsForCreatedWindow. In the mean<span class="line"><!---->    // WebContentsDelegate::ShouldResumeRequestsForCreatedWindow. In the mean<!----></span><br>    // time, navigations, including the initial one, that goes through OpenURL<span class="line"><!---->    // time, navigations, including the initial one, that goes through OpenURL<!----></span><br>    // should be delayed until embedder is ready to resume loading.<span class="line"><!---->    // should be delayed until embedder is ready to resume loading.<!----></span><br>    delayed_open_url_params_ = std::make_unique<OpenURLParams>(params);<span class="line"><!---->    delayed_open_url_params_ = std::make_unique&lt;OpenURLParams&gt;(params);<!----></span><br><br>    // If there was a navigation deferred when creating the window through<span class="line"><!---->    // If there was a navigation deferred when creating the window through<!----></span><br>    // CreateNewWindow, drop it in favor of this navigation.<span class="line"><!---->    // CreateNewWindow, drop it in favor of this navigation.<!----></span><br>    delayed_load_url_params_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    delayed_load_url_params_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  RenderFrameHost* source_render_frame_host = RenderFrameHost::FromID(  // (2)<span class="line"><!---->  RenderFrameHost* source_render_frame_host = RenderFrameHost::FromID(  // (2)<!----></span><br>      params.source_render_process_id, params.source_render_frame_id);<span class="line"><!---->      params.source_render_process_id, params.source_render_frame_id);<!----></span><br><br>  // Prevent frames that are not active (e.g. a prerendering page) from opening<span class="line"><!---->  // Prevent frames that are not active (e.g. a prerendering page) from opening<!----></span><br>  // new windows, tabs, popups, etc.<span class="line"><!---->  // new windows, tabs, popups, etc.<!----></span><br>  if (params.disposition != WindowOpenDisposition::CURRENT_TAB &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (params.disposition != WindowOpenDisposition::CURRENT_TAB class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When calling `OpenURLFromTab`, SideSearch will actually call `UnifiedSideSearchController::OpenURLFromTab`[2], it will use SideSearch's `browser_view` to call `OpenURL`. According to the ASAN log[3], `OpenURL` will  change to a new Tab, so the SidePanel will Close and destroy the corresponding FrameTree and RenderFrameHost.<span class="line"><!---->When calling `OpenURLFromTab`, SideSearch will actually call `UnifiedSideSearchController::OpenURLFromTab`[2], it will use SideSearch's `browser_view` to call `OpenURL`.         I can reproduce this in 1030430 (which is M106), but not 1012727 (104) or 1002919 (103). From what I can tell `--enable-features=SideSearch,SideSearchDSESupport` actually suffices for this (i.e. UnifiedSidePanel isn't required).<span class="line"><!---->I can reproduce this in 1030430 (which is M106), but not 1012727 (104) or 1002919 (103). From what I can tell `--enable-features=SideSearch,SideSearchDSESupport` actually suffices for this (i.e. UnifiedSidePanel isn't required).<!----></span><br><br>@Reporter: You seem to have tested with 1030370 (M106), but also say "Chrome version: 103.0.0.0". Could you confirm that you're only seeing this in M106?<span class="line"><!---->@Reporter: You seem to have tested with 1030370 (M106), but also say "Chrome version: 103.0.0.0". Could you confirm that you're only seeing this in M106?<!----></span><br><br>FoundIn-M106 for now. <span class="line"><!---->FoundIn-M106 for now. <!----></span><br><br>This is browser process memory corruption, but the interaction required to trigger it is pretty specific, hence Security_Severity-High rather than Critical.<span class="line"><!---->This is browser process memory corruption, but the interaction required to trigger it is pretty specific, hence Security_Severity-High rather than Critical.<!----></span><br><br>From what I can tell, at least SideSearchDSESupport isn't yet enabled in Stable, so this should probably be Security_Impact-Dev or something like that. But I'll wait for the feature team to confirm which channels this actually impacts currently.<span class="line"><!---->From what I can tell, at least SideSearchDSESupport isn't yet enabled in Stable, so this should probably be Security_Impact-Dev or something like that.         Currently this will only repro in versions M105+.<span class="line"><!---->Currently this will only repro in versions M105+.<!----></span><br><br>This requires Side Search and the Unified Side Panel to both be enabled (i.e. --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport ) - and for Side Search to be running the code that integrates it with the Unified Side Panel. The integration was added in Chrome M105.<span class="line"><!---->This requires Side Search and the Unified Side Panel to both be enabled (i.e. --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport ) - and for Side Search to be running the code that integrates it with the Unified Side Panel. The integration was added in Chrome M105.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the crash the user needs to explicitly enable the UnifiedSidePanel flag on M105 since the UnifiedSidePanel flag is currently only at 50% Canary / Dev. This likely still warrants a RBS label however so we'll want the fix to land by stable cut later this month.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the crash the user needs to explicitly enable the UnifiedSidePanel flag on M105 since the UnifiedSidePanel flag is currently only at 50% Canary / Dev. This likely still warrants a RBS label however so we'll want the fix to land by stable cut later this month.<!----></span><br><br>Yuheng is working on a fix and we should have this ready for a merge soon.<span class="line"><!---->Yuheng is working on a fix and we should have this ready for a merge soon.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2"><!---->d633877e387532422e93ec9ff61778b1676654c2<!----></a><br>Author: Yuheng Huang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yuheng Huang &lt;<!----></span>yuhengh@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yuhengh@chromium.org"><!---->yuhengh@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sun Aug 07 23:40:07 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sun Aug 07 23:40:07 2022<!----></span><br><br>Side search v2: fix uaf with right click search<span class="line"><!---->Side search v2: fix uaf with right click search<!----></span><br><br>When right click context menu and search Google for ... from the side<span class="line"><!---->When right click context menu and search Google for ... from the side<!----></span><br>search side panel, a new foreground will be created to trigger closing the side panel. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<span class="line"><!---->search side panel, a new foreground will be created to trigger closing the side panel. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<!----></span><br><br>This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<span class="line"><!---->This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1349687<a class="strike-through"         Merge review required: M105 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M105 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<span class="line"><!---->1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<span class="line"><!---->2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<!----></span><br>3. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<span class="line"><!---->search side panel, a new foreground will be created to trigger closing the side panel. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<!----></span><br><br>This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<span class="line"><!---->This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by merc....@gmail.com (Aug 3, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by merc....@gmail.com (Aug 3, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by merc....@gmail.com (Aug 3, 2022)

        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

        Description #1 by merc....@gmail.com (Aug 3, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. download asan-linux-release-1030370.zip and unzip<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-1030370.zip and unzip<!----></span><br>2. run `./chrome --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport   --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist`<span class="line"><!---->2. run `./chrome --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport   --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist`<!----></span><br>3. search anything with<span class="line"><!---->3. search anything with<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> and then navigate to any other search engine (such as<span class="line"><!----> and then navigate to any other search engine (such as<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>bing.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bing.com"><!---->bing.com<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>4. click `Open Search in Side Panel` to open side search in side panel<span class="line"><!---->4. click `Open Search in Side Panel` to open side search in side panel<!----></span><br>5. select any text in side search and right click to choose 'Search Google for XXX'<span class="line"><!---->5. select any text in side search and right click to choose 'Search Google for XXX'<!----></span><br><br>PS: In step 3 you must use <span class="line"><!---->PS: In step 3 you must use <!----></span>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>`. <span class="line"><!---->`. <!----></span>`<span class="line"><!---->`<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a>.xx`  cannot trigger the Side Search<span class="line"><!---->.xx`  cannot trigger the Side Search<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br># Root Cause <span class="line"><!----># Root Cause <!----></span><br><br>In `WebContentsImpl::OpenURL`[1], when `delelage_->OpenURLFromTab(this, params)` is called(1), the `source_render_frame_host`(2) could be freed in some conditions, the following use of `source_render_frame_host`(3) will cause UAF. <span class="line"><!---->In `WebContentsImpl::OpenURL`[1], when `delelage_-&gt;OpenURLFromTab(this, params)` is called(1), the `source_render_frame_host`(2) could be freed in some conditions, the following use of `source_render_frame_host`(3) will cause UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>WebContents* WebContentsImpl::OpenURL(const OpenURLParams& params) {<span class="line"><!---->WebContents* WebContentsImpl::OpenURL(const OpenURLParams&amp; params) {<!----></span><br>  TRACE_EVENT1("content", "WebContentsImpl::OpenURL", "url", params.url);<span class="line"><!---->  TRACE_EVENT1("content", "WebContentsImpl::OpenURL", "url", params.url);<!----></span><br>#if DCHECK_IS_ON()<span class="line"><!---->#if DCHECK_IS_ON()<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(params.Valid());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(params.Valid());<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br><br>  if (!delegate_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!delegate_) {<!----></span><br>    // Embedder can delay setting a delegate on new WebContents with<span class="line"><!---->    // Embedder can delay setting a delegate on new WebContents with<!----></span><br>    // WebContentsDelegate::ShouldResumeRequestsForCreatedWindow. class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When calling `OpenURLFromTab`, SideSearch will actually call `UnifiedSideSearchController::OpenURLFromTab`[2], it will use SideSearch's `browser_view` to call `OpenURL`. According to the ASAN log[3], `OpenURL` will  change to a new Tab, so the SidePanel will Close and destroy the corresponding FrameTree and RenderFrameHost.<span class="line"><!---->When calling `OpenURLFromTab`, SideSearch will actually call `UnifiedSideSearchController::OpenURLFromTab`[2], it will use SideSearch's `browser_view` to call `OpenURL`.         I can reproduce this in 1030430 (which is M106), but not 1012727 (104) or 1002919 (103). From what I can tell `--enable-features=SideSearch,SideSearchDSESupport` actually suffices for this (i.e. UnifiedSidePanel isn't required).<span class="line"><!---->I can reproduce this in 1030430 (which is M106), but not 1012727 (104) or 1002919 (103). From what I can tell `--enable-features=SideSearch,SideSearchDSESupport` actually suffices for this (i.e. UnifiedSidePanel isn't required).<!----></span><br><br>@Reporter: You seem to have tested with 1030370 (M106), but also say "Chrome version: 103.0.0.0". Could you confirm that you're only seeing this in M106?<span class="line"><!---->@Reporter: You seem to have tested with 1030370 (M106), but also say "Chrome version: 103.0.0.0". Could you confirm that you're only seeing this in M106?<!----></span><br><br>FoundIn-M106 for now. <span class="line"><!---->FoundIn-M106 for now. <!----></span><br><br>This is browser process memory corruption, but the interaction required to trigger it is pretty specific, hence Security_Severity-High rather than Critical.<span class="line"><!---->This is browser process memory corruption, but the interaction required to trigger it is pretty specific, hence Security_Severity-High rather than Critical.<!----></span><br><br>From what I can tell, at least SideSearchDSESupport isn't yet enabled in Stable, so this should probably be Security_Impact-Dev or something like that. But I'll wait for the feature team to confirm which channels this actually impacts currently.<span class="line"><!---->From what I can tell, at least SideSearchDSESupport isn't yet enabled in Stable, so this should probably be Security_Impact-Dev or something like that. But I'll wait for the feature team to confirm which channels this actually impacts currently.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Currently this will only repro in versions M105+.<span class="line"><!---->Currently this will only repro in versions M105+.<!----></span><br><br>This requires Side Search and the Unified Side Panel to both be enabled (i.e. --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport ) - and for Side Search to be running the code that integrates it with the Unified Side Panel. The integration was added in Chrome M105.<span class="line"><!---->This requires Side Search and the Unified Side Panel to both be enabled (i.e. --enable-features=SideSearch,UnifiedSidePanel,SideSearchDSESupport ) - and for Side Search to be running the code that integrates it with the Unified Side Panel. The integration was added in Chrome M105.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the crash the user needs to explicitly enable the UnifiedSidePanel flag on M105 since the UnifiedSidePanel flag is currently only at 50% Canary / Dev. This likely still warrants a RBS label however so we'll want the fix to land by stable cut later this month.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the crash the user needs to explicitly enable the UnifiedSidePanel flag on M105 since the UnifiedSidePanel flag is currently only at 50% Canary / Dev. This likely still warrants a RBS label however so we'll want the fix to land by stable cut later this month.<!----></span><br><br>Yuheng is working on a fix and we should have this ready for a merge soon.<span class="line"><!---->Yuheng is working on a fix and we should have this ready for a merge soon.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<span class="line"><!---->search side panel, a new foreground will be created to trigger closing the side panel. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<!----></span><br><br>This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<span class="line"><!---->This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1349687<a class="strike-through" When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<span class="line"><!---->search side panel, a new foreground will be created to trigger closing the side panel. When side panel is closed, it destroys the side panel WebView, which destroys side search side panel WebContents and cause a UaF inside WebContentsImpl::OpenURL.<!----></span><br><br>This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case. A possibly better approach in the future may be have the side panel framework not destroy the view when the side panel entry is still active.<span class="line"><!---->This CL prevents WebView from destroying side search side panel WebContents when side search entry is still active in this particular case.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }

          width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>
